triples.name: Autonomous agent
triples.relevance: The paper reviews AI agent frameworks, which are built on autonomous agent concepts for independent task execution.

triples.name: Multi-agent system
triples.relevance: Collaborative AI agents are fundamentally based on multi-agent system principles for coordinated problem-solving.

triples.name: Artificial intelligence
triples.relevance: AI agent frameworks are implementations of artificial intelligence techniques for autonomous decision-making and task execution.

triples.name: Latency (engineering)
triples.relevance: The paper analyzes framework performance using latency as a key quantitative metric for evaluation.

triples.name: Network throughput
triples.relevance: Throughput is used as a quantitative metric to evaluate the data processing capabilities of AI agent frameworks.

triples.name: Scalability
triples.relevance: Scalability is analyzed as a critical performance metric for determining framework suitability for growing workloads.

triples.name: Financial market
triples.relevance: The paper discusses applications of AI agents in financial markets as a key real-world domain.

triples.name: Risk management
triples.relevance: Risk management is identified as an important application area for autonomous AI systems.

triples.name: Business process automation
triples.relevance: Enterprise automation through AI agents is explored as a key application domain for autonomous systems.

triples.name: Software framework
triples.relevance: The paper reviews software frameworks as the primary tools for building and deploying AI agents.
